text.section:
Subject to the requirements of subsections (b) and (c) of this section, a dental hygienist may administer local anesthesia by infiltration for the purpose of anesthetizing soft tissue to facilitate the performance of dental hygiene procedures, but not as a medical specialty, provided the administration of local anesthesia is under the supervision of a dentist who:
Is physically present on the premises; and
Prescribes the administration of local anesthesia by the dental hygienist.

Before a dental hygienist may administer local anesthesia under subsection (a) of this section, the dental hygienist shall successfully complete the following:
Any educational requirements established by the Board; and
A written and clinical examination as required by the Board.
A dental hygienist shall obtain the educational requirements established by the Board under subsection (b)(1) of this section from an accredited dental hygiene program.
